oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Descriptive Book of Concord Post, No. 30, Grand Army of the Republic
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is the membership listing of the Grand Army of the Republic post in Concord (Knox County, Tenn." The book lists members and their units. It was passed through a member of the post, Romulus Calhoun Bonham. Born in 1839 died in 1911, he attended Holston College. He made his way to London, Kentucky and joined Co. K, 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. By Jan. 1862, he was a 1st sgt. and ended the war as a second lieutenant.
